datastructures

Interface Graph.Vertex<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - The type used to store in the vertex.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Enclosing interface:
    Graph<E,O>

    public static interface Graph.Vertex<E>
extends java.io.Serializable
    The Interface for the vertices. It's methods make it usable for a Graph. It's Methods are made to access the elements and traverse the Graph. Classes implementing this Interface can then be used vertices in the Graph allowing customization of the Vertices. Some Documentation names Vertices as Nodes.
    Since:
    25-8-2014
    Version:
    25-8-2014
    Author:
    stefanboodt
    See Also:
    Graph, Graph.vertices()

      • setElement

        void setElement(E element)
        Sets the element of this vertex to the given value.
        Parameters:
        element - The new value of the vertex.

      • getElement

        E getElement()
        Gets the Element stored in this vertex.
        Returns:
        The element that was stored in this edge.

      • addEdge

        <O> Graph.Edge<O> addEdge(Graph.Edge<O> edge)
        Adds the given edge to the Vertex.
        Parameters:
        edge - The edge to add.
        Returns:
        The Edge you just added, or null on failure.

      • getEdges

        <O> java.util.Collection<Graph.Edge<O>> getEdges()
        Returns the incident edges of this vertex.
        Returns:
        The edges that are incident to this vertex.

      • getAmountOfEdges

        default int getAmountOfEdges()
        Counts the amount of incident edges this vertex has. Please note that this default behavior simply returns the size of the collection returned by getEdges(), and as such you can not return a collection for which you need to specify the size by using this method.
        Returns:
        The amount of incident edges this vertex has.

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()

        Returns the hashCode of this Vertex. The hash code is calculated by adding the amount of incidentEdges to getEdges()Graph.Edge.hashCode(). All subclasses could also use Vertex#hashCode(Vertex) to calculate the hash code as this uses the wanted technique.

        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The hash code.

      • hashCode

        static <E> int hashCode(Graph.Vertex<E> vertex)
        Calculates the hashCode for the given vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertex - The vertex to calculate the hash code from.
        Returns:
        The hash code of the given vertex.

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected(Graph.Vertex<E> v)
        Checks if the vertex is connected in any way, either directly or indirectly, to the given vertex.
        Parameters:
        v - The vertex to check the connection to.
        Returns:
        true iff there is a path from this vertex to the given vertex.

      • isConnected

        default boolean isConnected()
        Checks if the Vertex is connected to any edge.
        Returns:
        true if this vertex is connected to an edge.
